intro: Garnotia ciliata var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smoothleaf garnotia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are typically smooth and hairless, giving it its varietal name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate foliage and subtle blooms.
